question: What are the names of disaster projects advertised before 2023
raw_answer: Citywide Guardrail Replacement, Westward Beach Road Shoulder Repairs, Outdoor Warning Sirens - Design, Clover Heights Storm Drain, Latigo Canyon Road Culvert Repairs, Latigo Canyon Road Roadway/Retaining Wall Improvements, Trancas Canyon Park Planting and Irrigation Repairs
evidence_answer: Citywide Guardrail Replacement, Westward Beach Road Shoulder Repairs, Outdoor Warning Sirens - Design, Clover Heights Storm Drain, Latigo Canyon Road Culvert Repairs, Latigo Canyon Road Roadway/Retaining Wall Improvements, Trancas Canyon Park Planting and Irrigation Repairs.

Disaster Projects (Construction)
None at this time

Disaster Projects (Completed)

Citywide Guardrail Replacement
Project Description: This project consisted of replacing the damaged guardrails throughout
the City caused by the Woolsey Fire on Encinal Canyon Road, Corral Canyon Road, and
Kanan Dume Road.

The project was combined with the County of Los Angeles’ damaged
guardrails. The project was completed in February 2021.

(cid:131) Complete Design: Spring 2022
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2022

Westward Beach Road.

project will be advertised for construction bids with construction
beginning in Fall 2022.

Clover Heights Storm Drain (FEMA Project)

The existing storm drain facility ends at the
